title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: Hi macbook turn on but issue with kernel panic ,try to mount USB with [B]ASD 3S155 [/B]but getting kernel messages also its very hot around U3600 ,will upload the image of kernel panic screen

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: If U3600 gets burning hot it may be fucked, they normally get a little warm but not finger burning. There is not much to loose with a kernel panic board so if in doubt pull U3600 off and see if it works again. Thunderbolt we can live without!

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: I found that pp15v_tbt short try to remove u9610 and u9410 and u3890 still same

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: Why are you not removing U3600? Just remove Q3880 to isolate any TBT current leak. TBT is never going to work again anyway.

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: remove q3880 still when loading on the half showing forbidden sign

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: I ask again why are you not removing U3600! You said it was getting burning hot! Also forbidden sign is usually just a corrupted OSX.

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: U3600 Removed and still same ,fan spin loud and stuck on half load the USB with ASD 3S155

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: I am really out of ideas on this one. There was obviously a voltage spike on the thunderbolt and this could have damaged pretty much everything. Also removing the TBT stuff should not cause the fan to run high so I have no idea what happened there. You booting EFI version of ASD?

title: Macbook Pro 13 (820-3462) A1425 Kernel panic
message: Kernel panic TLB validation dpi timeout
